intro: Phlegmariurus colanensis, commonly known as the Chilean clubmoss, is a species of spore-bearing plant belonging to the family Lycopodiaceae. It is a small, evergreen, terrestrial plant that typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky areas. The plant has a distinctive appearance with its upright, branching stems and small, scale-like leaves. It produces spores in specialized structures called sporangia, which are located on the underside of its leaves. Phlegmariurus colanensis plays a role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for various microorganisms and invertebrates.
